reviews.text:
One of the most efficient stations in London. The station has connections with national and international trains, as well as the London overground. Thus, it can be very busy at peak times. 

The architecture of King's Cross station is impressive: indeed, it is an 19th century restored station. The new section, which was recently added to the station, has a remarkable design. Worth a picture 😜.

Finally, you will be able to find here several shops and restaurants. Good place for some last minute shopping or just to grab a lovely, creamy coffee before taking the next train to your chosen destination!

Very busy station with an array of shops and places to sit down and eat. Relatively clean and quite welcoming though can seem overwhelming with a sea of other travellers. Big boards to indicate when train is due and all the destination stops, as well as  tannoy announcements.

Added to this, you have the famous Harry Potter shop located here which is very popular with people wanting to have their picture taken with a Harry Potter themed backdrop or purchase a souvenir from the store.

Is one of the most amazing station in London, with a lot of history behind.

Is the major point of connections on the tube (underground), linking most of the lines.

Above, the trains are serving the popular East Coast Main Line, with the newest trains - Azuma which are taking you up the north of the country and Scotland. You will also find the Great Northern trains and Grand Central trains.

Just next to this station is the other master piece station, St. Pancras International.

Enjoy!

King's Cross was absolutely beautiful! As a traveler from a rural area in the US, I hadn't ever seen a station like this. I spent at least an hour walking in and around the area. It was lovely. #letsguide
Beautiful, roomy station. Lots of amenities clean, comfortable. For Harry Potter fans, there's a little shop and a Platform 9 3/4 wall/entrance.
